newsitem.title: GERMANY: SOCCER SHOWCASE-VFB STUTTGART V BAYERN MUNICH FACTS/FIGURES.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER SHOWCASE-VFB STUTTGART V BAYERN MUNICH FACTS/FIGURES.

text.p: Facts and figures for Sunday's German first division match between VfB Stuttgart and Bayern Munich:
Major honours: German champions 1950, 1952, 1984, 1992, German Cup winners 1954, 1958

Major honours: European champions 1974, 1975, 1976, European Cup Winners' Cup winners 1967, UEFA Cup winners 1996. Record German champions 1932, 1969, 1972, 1973, 1974, 1980, 1981, 1985, 1986, 1987, 1989, 1990 1994, German Cup winners 1957, 1966, 1967, 1969, 1971, 1982, 1984, 1986.
Record goal scorer: Gerd Mueller 365 in 427 games (1965-79)
VfB Stuttgart v Bayern Munich league record: Played 58. Wins: VfB Stuttgart 10, Bayern Munich 34, 14 draws.
Last 10 seasons in Stuttgart from 1986-87 (Stuttgart score first). 1-3, 3-0, 1-2, 2-1, 0-3, 3-2, 2-3, 2-2, 0-2, 0-1
Corresponding match last season: VfB Stuttgart 0 Bayern Munich 1 (Scorer Juergen Klinsmann 48th), Attendance 53,000

Crucial Klinsmann goal against his old club helped Bayern extend lead at top of table to three points but Bavarians lost out to Borussia Dortmund in title race. Bayern played most of game with 10 men after Dieter Hamann was sent off in the 30th minute for foul on VfB striker Giovane Elber.
